title: Snap into a Slim Jim!
content:
This is probably heavily customized, but can anyone suggest something similar?   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524125755im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/28897.jpg)
author: glutton

comments.content:
Hi John. There are lots of distressed Couriers out there ...   
   
this one comes up first with a google for "typewriter fonts"   
 [http://www.free-typewriter-fonts.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524125755/http:/www.free-typewriter-fonts.com/)   
   
Whoever did this one should've rounded   
the cap and join when they outlined the font.
Maybe it wasn't Xtreme enough with rounded cap and join. Thanks, guys!

True ... also worth noting, the designer did the   
repeated letters, same distress marks thang.   
   
a fun thing to use to distress stuff   
is FilterIt's Fractalize Filter.   
   
 [http://www.cvalley.com/products/filterit4/](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524125755/http:/www.cvalley.com/products/filterit4/)
I noticed that. It reminds me of an old Image Club font, but for the life of me I can't remember the name.

the Image Club fonts of this ilk were called   
Schmutz, I think. Schmutz Corroded, Clogged.   
   
Grant could confirm.
Wow, how'd you find that? -- behind the typeface indeed! ;D

Chesh and I are like \*that\*.   
   
All three of my [Schmutz](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524125755/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/identifontframe.asp?fontname=schmutz) faces are still available from Agfa. Although, I believe that [FF Trixie](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524125755/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-trixie/) should warrant a mention while we're on the subject/

And who could forget Chandler 42, from PsyOps?   
   
 [http://www.psyops.com/html/spec\_chandler42.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524125755/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_chandler42.html)
